prompt: Declare a null or undefined variable and print its value
answer:
In JavaScript, you can declare a variable without assigning it a value. This variable will be `undefined`. Here's an example:

```javascript
let x;
console.log(x); // prints: undefined
```

Alternatively, you can declare a variable and explicitly set it to `null`:

```javascript
let x = null;
console.log(x); // prints: null
```

Note that `null` and `undefined` are not the same thing in JavaScript. `undefined` is a value that a variable has when it has not been assigned a value, while `null` is a value that a variable can be explicitly assigned to indicate that it has no value. 

To illustrate the difference:

```javascript
let x; // x is undefined
let y = null; // y is null

console.log(x === y); // prints: false
console.log(x === undefined); // prints: true
console.log(y === null); // prints: true
```
